revised_title: Fractals in Earthquakes: The Stick-Slip Model and Earthquake Predictability
tldr: This article discusses the fractal nature of earthquakes and the stick-slip model, which can explain the fractal features of seismic phenomena. The authors explore the predictability of destructive earthquakes using the stick-slip model and its modifications, focusing on the two-dimensional and one-dimensional versions of the model. They also introduce a hypothesis for aftershock occurrences based on the entropy relaxation and partial melting of the crust.
